titleStmt.title: See, heer, malignants foolerie retorted on them properly The Sound-Head, Round-Head, Rattle-Head well plac'd, where best is merited.

notesStmt.note: A satirical engraved plate, representing three figures of Ecclesiastics described as "Sound-Head, Rattle-Head, Round-Head"; the first being a Puritan, the last a Popish priest, and between them a composite figure with two faces, representing Robert Philips, the Queen's confessor, and Archbishop Laud.--Thomason.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
